channel.title: Woodmont Industrial News Feed
channel.description: Daily industrial and CRE updates across key regions

item.title: Eyal Ofer’s Global Holdings lands AI tenant at 25 Kent
item.description: An AI startup with a housing stipend is swapping Long Island City for Williamsburg’s waterfront. Voice analytics company Rilla inked a 57,000-square-foot lease at Global Holdings’ 25 Kent in one of the borough’s biggest office deals of the past year. The AI company will occupy the entire eighth-floor penthouse, along with nearly 4,000 square feet of private outdoor space, the landlord announced. The 10-year lease pushes occupancy at the eight-story building to 72 percent. The asking rent was $76 per square foot. Newmark’s Cooper Weisman and Ryan Gessin represented Rilla in the deal. The landlord was represented in-house by Craig […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Elizabeth Cryan

item.title: Billionaire Google co-founders descend on Miami
item.description: Google co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin have been shopping for luxury homes in Miami, and Page is the mystery buyer who spent more than $100 million on a waterfront estate that sold at the end of the year, The Real Deal has learned.  The two billionaires are among the wealthiest in the world. Page is No. 2 with a net worth of $272 billion, and Sergey Brin is No. 4 with a net worth of $253 billion, according to Bloomberg.  Page is the buyer of the Banyan Ridge in Coconut Grove, sources told TRD. The 4.5-acre waterfront compound at […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Katherine Kallergis

item.title: Trump Seeks To Ban Institutional Investors From Buying Houses
item.description: President Donald Trump said Wednesday he would immediately begin taking steps to ban large institutional investors from buying more single-family homes. In a social media post, the president said the American dream of buying and owning a home is increasingly...
item.category: PEOPLE NEWS — Personnel Moves in Industrial Brokerage/Development
item.author: ryan.wangman@bisnow.com

item.title: Carnegie House lease dispute goes to land owners
item.description: Co-op shareholders at Carnegie House were dealt a blow by the New York County Supreme Court, which ruled in favor of the parcel’s landowners in a dispute over the ground lease. The court upheld a rent hike for the property’s ground lease, the Wall Street Journal reported, affecting the payments of hundreds of shareholders that may no longer be able to keep up with payments. The rent increase, enacted by David Werner and Rubin Schron, is expected to bring the annual ground rent from $4.36 million to approximately $24 million. “In the middle of a housing crisis, our billionaire landowners […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: TRD Staff

item.title: Spec developer Michael Klinger sells Golden Beach home for $27M
item.description: Spec developer Michael Klinger and his wife Michelle Klinger sold a home in Golden Beach for $27.1 million, marking a record price for bayfront homes in the neighborhood.  Klinger sold the house at 194 South Island Drive to a Delaware entity, a spokesperson confirmed. The deed has yet to appear in public records and the true buyer is unknown.  Dina Goldentayer with Douglas Elliman and Joel Lusky with the Brokerage South Florida Real Estate had the listing. Jonathan Mann with the Jills Zeder Group at Coldwell Banker Realty brought the buyer.  Michael Klinger is the founder of Saber Real Estate […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Kate Hinsche

item.title: Autolus tests Cellares’ automated CAR T manufacturing tech
item.description: Autolus Therapeutics will evaluate Cellares’ automated Cell Shuttle platform to see if it can support commercial CAR T therapy manufacturing. The post Autolus tests Cellares’ automated CAR T manufacturing tech appeared first on NJBIZ .
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Matthew Fazelpoor

item.title: Rithm Capital lands first big lease since Paramount takeover
item.description: While kicking Albert Behler to the curb at 1633 Broadway, Rithm Capital is welcoming a major tenant to the Midtown Manhattan office, its first significant move since its billion-dollar acquisition of Paramount Group last month. Paris-based financial services firm Natixis agreed to take 203,000 square feet at 1633 Broadway, the Commercial Observer reported. The lease was signed before the end of the fourth quarter and was disclosed in a Savills report. Details of the lease were not disclosed, though the deal is said to be long-term as Natixis relocates from 1251 Sixth Avenue. Asking rents at its new digs range […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: TRD Staff

item.title: W.P. Carey Shells Out $320M For Portfolio Of Life Time Locations
item.description: Net lease real estate investment trust W.P. Carey scooped up a portfolio of 10 Life Time athletic country club locations across the eastern and central U.S. for $322M. The REIT purchased the properties from TPG Angelo Gordon, which previously acquired...

item.author: ryan.wangman@bisnow.com

item.title: Employees say they’re fuzzy on their employers’ AI strategy
item.description: Front-line workers in sectors such as retail, healthcare and manufacturing are less likely to use AI than those in “knowledge-based” jobs, according to Gallup.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Carolyn Crist

item.title: Russo sells 111-unit loft-style rental property in Verona for $56 million, CBRE says
item.description: Russo Development has sold a 111-unit multifamily property in Verona that it completed as part of an adaptive reuse of a historic factory building, in a deal arranged by CBRE.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Joshua Burd

item.title: Blau & Berg taps Jason Crimmins as CEO, Conte as president with Ken Crimmins remaining as chairman
item.description: The Blau & Berg Co. has announced a new leadership team, with Jason Crimmins taking over as CEO and Alessandro Conte as president of the historic real estate services firm.

item.title: Barnes & Noble leases 25,000 sq. ft. for new Livingston store in deal by RIPCO, VanRock
item.description: Barnes & Noble has found a new home in Livingston after taking nearly 25,000 square feet at a Route 10 retail center, brokers with RIPCO Real Estate announced Monday.

item.author: Joshua Burd

item.title: Electronics repair, cell phone retailer expands to Jersey City with new lease, Cervelli says
item.description: An electronics repair and cell phone business has leased 1,700 square feet of retail space in Jersey City, in a deal arranged by Cervelli Real Estate & Property Management.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News

item.title: Lennar sells majority control of multifamily division to TPG after years of losses
item.description: Lennar Corp., the country’s second-largest homebuilder, sold its majority stake in its multifamily development division to San Francisco-based asset management firm TPG.  Lennar will hold onto a minority stake in Quarterra, and TPG Real Estate has agreed to invest $1 billion into the multifamily developer, and “potentially raise more capital for future growth,” the South Florida Business Journal reported. Lennar and TPG did not disclose the details of the deal.  Homebuilders are facing weak demand brought on by high interest rates and affordability concerns, and the multifamily market is flaccid across most of the country.  Miami-based Lennar reported $44 million […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: TRD Staff

item.title: Boca Raton mixed-use project scores $74M Bank OZK construction loan
item.description: A Compson Associates-led joint venture landed a $74 million construction loan for a planned mixed-use complex in Palm Beach County that started construction last month. Little Rock, Arkansas-based Bank Ozk provided the financing for The Aletto, which consists of two 10-story mid-rises with 140,000 square feet of retail and office space on a 1.3-acre site at 119 East Palmetto Park Road in Boca Raton, according to records and a news release. The project also includes a 550-space parking garage.  Boca Raton-based Compson, led by Robert D’Angelo and Carl E. Klepper, Jr., is partnering with West Palm Beach-based North American Development […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Francisco Alvarado

item.title: Nutrition moguls sell waterfront Coconut Grove mansion for $72M
item.description: Shaklee Corp. CEO Roger Barnett and his wife, journalist Sloan Barnett, sold their waterfront Coconut Grove mansion for $71.9 million, marking the latest high-priced trade in the popular Miami neighborhood.  The Barnetts sold the 10,400-square-foot, seven-bedroom and eight-bathroom home at 3085 Munroe Drive to a trust managed by Greenberg Traurig attorney Benjamin Babcock and Mary McFadden Quisenberry, chief operating officer at San Francisco-based Rosewood Family Advisors.  The Barnetts’ ownership of the property was revealed by The Real Deal when they acquired the nearly 1-acre property from billionaire businessman Jorge Mas in 2021 for $45.9 million. That means the Barnetts sold […] This article originally appeared on The Real Deal. Click here to read the full story.
item.category: RELEVANT ARTICLES — Macro Trends & Industrial Real Estate News
item.author: Katherine Kallergis

item.description: Brad Jacobs’ latest venture, QXO with it plans to roll up a diffuse network of building product suppliers through acquisitions, has just armed itself with a lot more cash to do so. At its most basic, QXO is a logistics play: put a growing amount of assets of a fragmented building supply chain ecosystem under […] The post Jacobs’ QXO gets big investment from group led by Apollo appeared first on FreightWaves .

item.title: When healthcare M&A hits the cold chain
item.description: The $4.8 billion acquisition of Amicus Therapeutics by BioMarin is, on its surface, a familiar healthcare story: portfolio expansion, accelerated revenue growth, and a stronger foothold in the rare disease market. But beneath the financial headlines sits a less visible and increasingly critical reality. For supply chain and cold chain professionals, deals like this are […] The post When healthcare M&A hits the cold chain appeared first on FreightWaves .

item.description: Eastern Pennsylvania has been a poster child for the post-pandemic warehouse construction blitz. That development boom slowed slightly this year, with 32 new projects breaking ground, down from 35 in 2024 and 36 in 2023, according to Lee & Associates....
